11/**
12 * @fileoverview Classes for tracking asynchronous operations and handling the
13 * results. The Deferred object here is patterned after the Deferred object in
14 * the Twisted python networking framework.
15 *
16 * See: http://twistedmatrix.com/projects/core/documentation/howto/defer.html
17 *
18 * Based on the Dojo code which in turn is based on the MochiKit code.
19 *
20 * @author arv@google.com (Erik Arvidsson)
21 * @author brenneman@google.com (Shawn Brenneman)
22 */
23
24goog.provide('goog.async.Deferred');
25goog.provide('goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError');
26goog.provide('goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError');
27
28goog.require('goog.Promise');
29goog.require('goog.Thenable');
30goog.require('goog.array');
31goog.require('goog.asserts');
32goog.require('goog.debug.Error');
33
34
35
36/**
37 * A Deferred represents the result of an asynchronous operation. A Deferred
38 * instance has no result when it is created, and is "fired" (given an initial
39 * result) by calling {@code callback} or {@code errback}.
40 *
41 * Once fired, the result is passed through a sequence of callback functions
42 * registered with {@code addCallback} or {@code addErrback}. The functions may
43 * mutate the result before it is passed to the next function in the sequence.
44 *
45 * Callbacks and errbacks may be added at any time, including after the Deferred
46 * has been "fired". If there are no pending actions in the execution sequence
47 * of a fired Deferred, any new callback functions will be called with the last
48 * computed result. Adding a callback function is the only way to access the
49 * result of the Deferred.
50 *
51 * If a Deferred operation is canceled, an optional user-provided cancellation
52 * function is invoked which may perform any special cleanup, followed by firing
53 * the Deferred's errback sequence with a {@code CanceledError}. If the
54 * Deferred has already fired, cancellation is ignored.
55 *
56 * Deferreds may be templated to a specific type they produce using generics
57 * with syntax such as:
58 * <code>
59 * /** @type {goog.async.Deferred<string>} *&#47;
60 * var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
61 * // Compiler can infer that foo is a string.
62 * d.addCallback(function(foo) {...});
63 * d.callback('string'); // Checked to be passed a string
64 * </code>
65 * Since deferreds are often used to produce different values across a chain,
66 * the type information is not propagated across chains, but rather only
67 * associated with specifically cast objects.
68 *
69 * @param {Function=} opt_onCancelFunction A function that will be called if the
70 * Deferred is canceled. If provided, this function runs before the
71 * Deferred is fired with a {@code CanceledError}.
72 * @param {Object=} opt_defaultScope The default object context to call
73 * callbacks and errbacks in.
74 * @constructor
75 * @implements {goog.Thenable<VALUE>}
76 * @template VALUE
77 */
78goog.async.Deferred = function(opt_onCancelFunction, opt_defaultScope) {
79 /**
80 * Entries in the sequence are arrays containing a callback, an errback, and
81 * an optional scope. The callback or errback in an entry may be null.
82 * @type {!Array<!Array>}
83 * @private
84 */
85 this.sequence_ = [];
86
87 /**
88 * Optional function that will be called if the Deferred is canceled.
89 * @type {Function|undefined}
90 * @private
91 */
92 this.onCancelFunction_ = opt_onCancelFunction;
93
94 /**
95 * The default scope to execute callbacks and errbacks in.
96 * @type {Object}
97 * @private
98 */
99 this.defaultScope_ = opt_defaultScope || null;
100
101 /**
102 * Whether the Deferred has been fired.
103 * @type {boolean}
104 * @private
105 */
106 this.fired_ = false;
107
108 /**
109 * Whether the last result in the execution sequence was an error.
110 * @type {boolean}
111 * @private
112 */
113 this.hadError_ = false;
114
115 /**
116 * The current Deferred result, updated as callbacks and errbacks are
117 * executed.
118 * @type {*}
119 * @private
120 */
121 this.result_ = undefined;
122
123 /**
124 * Whether the Deferred is blocked waiting on another Deferred to fire. If a
125 * callback or errback returns a Deferred as a result, the execution sequence
126 * is blocked until that Deferred result becomes available.
127 * @type {boolean}
128 * @private
129 */
130 this.blocked_ = false;
131
132 /**
133 * Whether this Deferred is blocking execution of another Deferred. If this
134 * instance was returned as a result in another Deferred's execution
135 * sequence,that other Deferred becomes blocked until this instance's
136 * execution sequence completes. No additional callbacks may be added to a
137 * Deferred once it is blocking another instance.
138 * @type {boolean}
139 * @private
140 */
141 this.blocking_ = false;
142
143 /**
144 * Whether the Deferred has been canceled without having a custom cancel
145 * function.
146 * @type {boolean}
147 * @private
148 */
149 this.silentlyCanceled_ = false;
150
151 /**
152 * If an error is thrown during Deferred execution with no errback to catch
153 * it, the error is rethrown after a timeout. Reporting the error after a
154 * timeout allows execution to continue in the calling context (empty when
155 * no error is scheduled).
156 * @type {number}
157 * @private
158 */
159 this.unhandledErrorId_ = 0;
160
161 /**
162 * If this Deferred was created by branch(), this will be the "parent"
163 * Deferred.
164 * @type {goog.async.Deferred}
165 * @private
166 */
167 this.parent_ = null;
168
169 /**
170 * The number of Deferred objects that have been branched off this one. This
171 * will be decremented whenever a branch is fired or canceled.
172 * @type {number}
173 * @private
174 */
175 this.branches_ = 0;
176
177 if (goog.async.Deferred.LONG_STACK_TRACES) {
178 /**
179 * Holds the stack trace at time of deferred creation if the JS engine
180 * provides the Error.captureStackTrace API.
181 * @private {?string}
182 */
183 this.constructorStack_ = null;
184 if (Error.captureStackTrace) {
185 var target = { stack: '' };
186 Error.captureStackTrace(target, goog.async.Deferred);
187 // Check if Error.captureStackTrace worked. It fails in gjstest.
188 if (typeof target.stack == 'string') {
189 // Remove first line and force stringify to prevent memory leak due to
190 // holding on to actual stack frames.
191 this.constructorStack_ = target.stack.replace(/^[^\n]*\n/, '');
192 }
193 }
194 }
195};
196
197
198/**
199 * @define {boolean} Whether unhandled errors should always get rethrown to the
200 * global scope. Defaults to the value of goog.DEBUG.
201 */
202goog.define('goog.async.Deferred.STRICT_ERRORS', false);
203
204
205/**
206 * @define {boolean} Whether to attempt to make stack traces long. Defaults to
207 * the value of goog.DEBUG.
208 */
209goog.define('goog.async.Deferred.LONG_STACK_TRACES', false);
210
211
212/**
213 * Cancels a Deferred that has not yet been fired, or is blocked on another
214 * deferred operation. If this Deferred is waiting for a blocking Deferred to
215 * fire, the blocking Deferred will also be canceled.
216 *
217 * If this Deferred was created by calling branch() on a parent Deferred with
218 * opt_propagateCancel set to true, the parent may also be canceled. If
219 * opt_deepCancel is set, cancel() will be called on the parent (as well as any
220 * other ancestors if the parent is also a branch). If one or more branches were
221 * created with opt_propagateCancel set to true, the parent will be canceled if
222 * cancel() is called on all of those branches.
223 *
224 * @param {boolean=} opt_deepCancel If true, cancels this Deferred's parent even
225 * if cancel() hasn't been called on some of the parent's branches. Has no
226 * effect on a branch without opt_propagateCancel set to true.
227 */
228goog.async.Deferred.prototype.cancel = function(opt_deepCancel) {
229 if (!this.hasFired()) {
230 if (this.parent_) {
231 // Get rid of the parent reference before potentially running the parent's
232 // canceler function to ensure that this cancellation isn't
233 // double-counted.
234 var parent = this.parent_;
235 delete this.parent_;
236 if (opt_deepCancel) {
237 parent.cancel(opt_deepCancel);
238 } else {
239 parent.branchCancel_();
240 }
241 }
242
243 if (this.onCancelFunction_) {
244 // Call in user-specified scope.
245 this.onCancelFunction_.call(this.defaultScope_, this);
246 } else {
247 this.silentlyCanceled_ = true;
248 }
249 if (!this.hasFired()) {
250 this.errback(new goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError(this));
251 }
252 } else if (this.result_ instanceof goog.async.Deferred) {
253 this.result_.cancel();
254 }
255};
256
257
258/**
259 * Handle a single branch being canceled. Once all branches are canceled, this
260 * Deferred will be canceled as well.
261 *
262 * @private
263 */
264goog.async.Deferred.prototype.branchCancel_ = function() {
265 this.branches_--;
266 if (this.branches_ <= 0) {
267 this.cancel();
268 }
269};
270
271
272/**
273 * Called after a blocking Deferred fires. Unblocks this Deferred and resumes
274 * its execution sequence.
275 *
276 * @param {boolean} isSuccess Whether the result is a success or an error.
277 * @param {*} res The result of the blocking Deferred.
278 * @private
279 */
280goog.async.Deferred.prototype.continue_ = function(isSuccess, res) {
281 this.blocked_ = false;
282 this.updateResult_(isSuccess, res);
283};
284
285
286/**
287 * Updates the current result based on the success or failure of the last action
288 * in the execution sequence.
289 *
290 * @param {boolean} isSuccess Whether the new result is a success or an error.
291 * @param {*} res The result.
292 * @private
293 */
294goog.async.Deferred.prototype.updateResult_ = function(isSuccess, res) {
295 this.fired_ = true;
296 this.result_ = res;
297 this.hadError_ = !isSuccess;
298 this.fire_();
299};
300
301
302/**
303 * Verifies that the Deferred has not yet been fired.
304 *
305 * @private
306 * @throws {Error} If this has already been fired.
307 */
308goog.async.Deferred.prototype.check_ = function() {
309 if (this.hasFired()) {
310 if (!this.silentlyCanceled_) {
311 throw new goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError(this);
312 }
313 this.silentlyCanceled_ = false;
314 }
315};
316
317
318/**
319 * Fire the execution sequence for this Deferred by passing the starting result
320 * to the first registered callback.
321 * @param {VALUE=} opt_result The starting result.
322 */
323goog.async.Deferred.prototype.callback = function(opt_result) {
324 this.check_();
325 this.assertNotDeferred_(opt_result);
326 this.updateResult_(true /* isSuccess */, opt_result);
327};
328
329
330/**
331 * Fire the execution sequence for this Deferred by passing the starting error
332 * result to the first registered errback.
333 * @param {*=} opt_result The starting error.
334 */
335goog.async.Deferred.prototype.errback = function(opt_result) {
336 this.check_();
337 this.assertNotDeferred_(opt_result);
338 this.makeStackTraceLong_(opt_result);
339 this.updateResult_(false /* isSuccess */, opt_result);
340};
341
342
343/**
344 * Attempt to make the error's stack trace be long in that it contains the
345 * stack trace from the point where the deferred was created on top of the
346 * current stack trace to give additional context.
347 * @param {*} error
348 * @private
349 */
350goog.async.Deferred.prototype.makeStackTraceLong_ = function(error) {
351 if (!goog.async.Deferred.LONG_STACK_TRACES) {
352 return;
353 }
354 if (this.constructorStack_ && goog.isObject(error) && error.stack &&
355 // Stack looks like it was system generated. See
356 // https://code.google.com/p/v8/wiki/JavaScriptStackTraceApi
357 (/^[^\n]+(\n [^\n]+)+/).test(error.stack)) {
358 error.stack = error.stack + '\nDEFERRED OPERATION:\n' +
359 this.constructorStack_;
360 }
361};
362
363
364/**
365 * Asserts that an object is not a Deferred.
366 * @param {*} obj The object to test.
367 * @throws {Error} Throws an exception if the object is a Deferred.
368 * @private
369 */
370goog.async.Deferred.prototype.assertNotDeferred_ = function(obj) {
371 goog.asserts.assert(
372 !(obj instanceof goog.async.Deferred),
373 'An execution sequence may not be initiated with a blocking Deferred.');
374};
375
376
377/**
378 * Register a callback function to be called with a successful result. If no
379 * value is returned by the callback function, the result value is unchanged. If
380 * a new value is returned, it becomes the Deferred result and will be passed to
381 * the next callback in the execution sequence.
382 *
383 * If the function throws an error, the error becomes the new result and will be
384 * passed to the next errback in the execution chain.
385 *
386 * If the function returns a Deferred, the execution sequence will be blocked
387 * until that Deferred fires. Its result will be passed to the next callback (or
388 * errback if it is an error result) in this Deferred's execution sequence.
389 *
390 * @param {!function(this:T,VALUE):?} cb The function to be called with a
391 * successful result.
392 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the callback in.
393 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} This Deferred.
394 * @template T
395 */
396goog.async.Deferred.prototype.addCallback = function(cb, opt_scope) {
397 return this.addCallbacks(cb, null, opt_scope);
398};
399
400
401/**
402 * Register a callback function to be called with an error result. If no value
403 * is returned by the function, the error result is unchanged. If a new error
404 * value is returned or thrown, that error becomes the Deferred result and will
405 * be passed to the next errback in the execution sequence.
406 *
407 * If the errback function handles the error by returning a non-error value,
408 * that result will be passed to the next normal callback in the sequence.
409 *
410 * If the function returns a Deferred, the execution sequence will be blocked
411 * until that Deferred fires. Its result will be passed to the next callback (or
412 * errback if it is an error result) in this Deferred's execution sequence.
413 *
414 * @param {!function(this:T,?):?} eb The function to be called on an
415 * unsuccessful result.
416 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the errback in.
417 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred<VALUE>} This Deferred.
418 * @template T
419 */
420goog.async.Deferred.prototype.addErrback = function(eb, opt_scope) {
421 return this.addCallbacks(null, eb, opt_scope);
422};
423
424
425/**
426 * Registers one function as both a callback and errback.
427 *
428 * @param {!function(this:T,?):?} f The function to be called on any result.
429 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the function in.
430 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} This Deferred.
431 * @template T
432 */
433goog.async.Deferred.prototype.addBoth = function(f, opt_scope) {
434 return this.addCallbacks(f, f, opt_scope);
435};
436
437
438/**
439 * Like addBoth, but propagates uncaught exceptions in the errback.
440 *
441 * @param {function(this:T,?):?} f The function to be called on any result.
442 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the function in.
443 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred<VALUE>} This Deferred.
444 * @template T
445 */
446goog.async.Deferred.prototype.addFinally = function(f, opt_scope) {
447 var self = this;
448 return this.addCallbacks(f, function(err) {
449 var result = f.call(self, err);
450 if (!goog.isDef(result)) {
451 throw err;
452 }
453 return result;
454 }, opt_scope);
455};
456
457
458/**
459 * Registers a callback function and an errback function at the same position
460 * in the execution sequence. Only one of these functions will execute,
461 * depending on the error state during the execution sequence.
462 *
463 * NOTE: This is not equivalent to {@code def.addCallback().addErrback()}! If
464 * the callback is invoked, the errback will be skipped, and vice versa.
465 *
466 * @param {?(function(this:T,VALUE):?)} cb The function to be called on a
467 * successful result.
468 * @param {?(function(this:T,?):?)} eb The function to be called on an
469 * unsuccessful result.
470 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the functions in.
471 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} This Deferred.
472 * @template T
473 */
474goog.async.Deferred.prototype.addCallbacks = function(cb, eb, opt_scope) {
475 goog.asserts.assert(!this.blocking_, 'Blocking Deferreds can not be re-used');
476 this.sequence_.push([cb, eb, opt_scope]);
477 if (this.hasFired()) {
478 this.fire_();
479 }
480 return this;
481};
482
483
484/**
485 * Implements {@see goog.Thenable} for seamless integration with
486 * {@see goog.Promise}.
487 * Deferred results are mutable and may represent multiple values over
488 * their lifetime. Calling {@code then} on a Deferred returns a Promise
489 * with the result of the Deferred at that point in its callback chain.
490 * Note that if the Deferred result is never mutated, and only
491 * {@code then} calls are made, the Deferred will behave like a Promise.
492 *
493 * @override
494 */
495goog.async.Deferred.prototype.then = function(opt_onFulfilled, opt_onRejected,
496 opt_context) {
497 var resolve, reject;
498 var promise = new goog.Promise(function(res, rej) {
499 // Copying resolvers to outer scope, so that they are available when the
500 // deferred callback fires (which may be synchronous).
501 resolve = res;
502 reject = rej;
503 });
504 this.addCallbacks(resolve, function(reason) {
505 if (reason instanceof goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError) {
506 promise.cancel();
507 } else {
508 reject(reason);
509 }
510 });
511 return promise.then(opt_onFulfilled, opt_onRejected, opt_context);
512};
513goog.Thenable.addImplementation(goog.async.Deferred);
514
515
516/**
517 * Links another Deferred to the end of this Deferred's execution sequence. The
518 * result of this execution sequence will be passed as the starting result for
519 * the chained Deferred, invoking either its first callback or errback.
520 *
521 * @param {!goog.async.Deferred} otherDeferred The Deferred to chain.
522 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} This Deferred.
523 */
524goog.async.Deferred.prototype.chainDeferred = function(otherDeferred) {
525 this.addCallbacks(
526 otherDeferred.callback, otherDeferred.errback, otherDeferred);
527 return this;
528};
529
530
531/**
532 * Makes this Deferred wait for another Deferred's execution sequence to
533 * complete before continuing.
534 *
535 * This is equivalent to adding a callback that returns {@code otherDeferred},
536 * but doesn't prevent additional callbacks from being added to
537 * {@code otherDeferred}.
538 *
539 * @param {!goog.async.Deferred|!goog.Thenable} otherDeferred The Deferred
540 * to wait for.
541 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} This Deferred.
542 */
543goog.async.Deferred.prototype.awaitDeferred = function(otherDeferred) {
544 if (!(otherDeferred instanceof goog.async.Deferred)) {
545 // The Thenable case.
546 return this.addCallback(function() {
547 return otherDeferred;
548 });
549 }
550 return this.addCallback(goog.bind(otherDeferred.branch, otherDeferred));
551};
552
553
554/**
555 * Creates a branch off this Deferred's execution sequence, and returns it as a
556 * new Deferred. The branched Deferred's starting result will be shared with the
557 * parent at the point of the branch, even if further callbacks are added to the
558 * parent.
559 *
560 * All branches at the same stage in the execution sequence will receive the
561 * same starting value.
562 *
563 * @param {boolean=} opt_propagateCancel If cancel() is called on every child
564 * branch created with opt_propagateCancel, the parent will be canceled as
565 * well.
566 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred<VALUE>} A Deferred that will be started with
567 * the computed result from this stage in the execution sequence.
568 */
569goog.async.Deferred.prototype.branch = function(opt_propagateCancel) {
570 var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
571 this.chainDeferred(d);
572 if (opt_propagateCancel) {
573 d.parent_ = this;
574 this.branches_++;
575 }
576 return d;
577};
578
579
580/**
581 * @return {boolean} Whether the execution sequence has been started on this
582 * Deferred by invoking {@code callback} or {@code errback}.
583 */
584goog.async.Deferred.prototype.hasFired = function() {
585 return this.fired_;
586};
587
588
589/**
590 * @param {*} res The latest result in the execution sequence.
591 * @return {boolean} Whether the current result is an error that should cause
592 * the next errback to fire. May be overridden by subclasses to handle
593 * special error types.
594 * @protected
595 */
596goog.async.Deferred.prototype.isError = function(res) {
597 return res instanceof Error;
598};
599
600
601/**
602 * @return {boolean} Whether an errback exists in the remaining sequence.
603 * @private
604 */
605goog.async.Deferred.prototype.hasErrback_ = function() {
606 return goog.array.some(this.sequence_, function(sequenceRow) {
607 // The errback is the second element in the array.
608 return goog.isFunction(sequenceRow[1]);
609 });
610};
611
612
613/**
614 * Exhausts the execution sequence while a result is available. The result may
615 * be modified by callbacks or errbacks, and execution will block if the
616 * returned result is an incomplete Deferred.
617 *
618 * @private
619 */
620goog.async.Deferred.prototype.fire_ = function() {
621 if (this.unhandledErrorId_ && this.hasFired() && this.hasErrback_()) {
622 // It is possible to add errbacks after the Deferred has fired. If a new
623 // errback is added immediately after the Deferred encountered an unhandled
624 // error, but before that error is rethrown, the error is unscheduled.
625 goog.async.Deferred.unscheduleError_(this.unhandledErrorId_);
626 this.unhandledErrorId_ = 0;
627 }
628
629 if (this.parent_) {
630 this.parent_.branches_--;
631 delete this.parent_;
632 }
633
634 var res = this.result_;
635 var unhandledException = false;
636 var isNewlyBlocked = false;
637
638 while (this.sequence_.length && !this.blocked_) {
639 var sequenceEntry = this.sequence_.shift();
640
641 var callback = sequenceEntry[0];
642 var errback = sequenceEntry[1];
643 var scope = sequenceEntry[2];
644
645 var f = this.hadError_ ? errback : callback;
646 if (f) {
647 /** @preserveTry */
648 try {
649 var ret = f.call(scope || this.defaultScope_, res);
650
651 // If no result, then use previous result.
652 if (goog.isDef(ret)) {
653 // Bubble up the error as long as the return value hasn't changed.
654 this.hadError_ = this.hadError_ && (ret == res || this.isError(ret));
655 this.result_ = res = ret;
656 }
657
658 if (goog.Thenable.isImplementedBy(res) ||
659 (typeof goog.global['Promise'] === 'function' &&
660 res instanceof goog.global['Promise'])) {
661 isNewlyBlocked = true;
662 this.blocked_ = true;
663 }
664
665 } catch (ex) {
666 res = ex;
667 this.hadError_ = true;
668 this.makeStackTraceLong_(res);
669
670 if (!this.hasErrback_()) {
671 // If an error is thrown with no additional errbacks in the queue,
672 // prepare to rethrow the error.
673 unhandledException = true;
674 }
675 }
676 }
677 }
678
679 this.result_ = res;
680
681 if (isNewlyBlocked) {
682 var onCallback = goog.bind(this.continue_, this, true /* isSuccess */);
683 var onErrback = goog.bind(this.continue_, this, false /* isSuccess */);
684
685 if (res instanceof goog.async.Deferred) {
686 res.addCallbacks(onCallback, onErrback);
687 res.blocking_ = true;
688 } else {
689 res.then(onCallback, onErrback);
690 }
691 } else if (goog.async.Deferred.STRICT_ERRORS && this.isError(res) &&
692 !(res instanceof goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError)) {
693 this.hadError_ = true;
694 unhandledException = true;
695 }
696
697 if (unhandledException) {
698 // Rethrow the unhandled error after a timeout. Execution will continue, but
699 // the error will be seen by global handlers and the user. The throw will
700 // be canceled if another errback is appended before the timeout executes.
701 // The error's original stack trace is preserved where available.
702 this.unhandledErrorId_ = goog.async.Deferred.scheduleError_(res);
703 }
704};
705
706
707/**
708 * Creates a Deferred that has an initial result.
709 *
710 * @param {*=} opt_result The result.
711 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} The new Deferred.
712 */
713goog.async.Deferred.succeed = function(opt_result) {
714 var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
715 d.callback(opt_result);
716 return d;
717};
718
719
720/**
721 * Creates a Deferred that fires when the given promise resolves.
722 * Use only during migration to Promises.
723 *
724 * @param {!goog.Promise<T>} promise
725 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred<T>} The new Deferred.
726 * @template T
727 */
728goog.async.Deferred.fromPromise = function(promise) {
729 var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
730 d.callback();
731 d.addCallback(function() {
732 return promise;
733 });
734 return d;
735};
736
737
738/**
739 * Creates a Deferred that has an initial error result.
740 *
741 * @param {*} res The error result.
742 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} The new Deferred.
743 */
744goog.async.Deferred.fail = function(res) {
745 var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
746 d.errback(res);
747 return d;
748};
749
750
751/**
752 * Creates a Deferred that has already been canceled.
753 *
754 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} The new Deferred.
755 */
756goog.async.Deferred.canceled = function() {
757 var d = new goog.async.Deferred();
758 d.cancel();
759 return d;
760};
761
762
763/**
764 * Normalizes values that may or may not be Deferreds.
765 *
766 * If the input value is a Deferred, the Deferred is branched (so the original
767 * execution sequence is not modified) and the input callback added to the new
768 * branch. The branch is returned to the caller.
769 *
770 * If the input value is not a Deferred, the callback will be executed
771 * immediately and an already firing Deferred will be returned to the caller.
772 *
773 * In the following (contrived) example, if <code>isImmediate</code> is true
774 * then 3 is alerted immediately, otherwise 6 is alerted after a 2-second delay.
775 *
776 * <pre>
777 * var value;
778 * if (isImmediate) {
779 * value = 3;
780 * } else {
781 * value = new goog.async.Deferred();
782 * setTimeout(function() { value.callback(6); }, 2000);
783 * }
784 *
785 * var d = goog.async.Deferred.when(value, alert);
786 * </pre>
787 *
788 * @param {*} value Deferred or normal value to pass to the callback.
789 * @param {!function(this:T, ?):?} callback The callback to execute.
790 * @param {T=} opt_scope An optional scope to call the callback in.
791 * @return {!goog.async.Deferred} A new Deferred that will call the input
792 * callback with the input value.
793 * @template T
794 */
795goog.async.Deferred.when = function(value, callback, opt_scope) {
796 if (value instanceof goog.async.Deferred) {
797 return value.branch(true).addCallback(callback, opt_scope);
798 } else {
799 return goog.async.Deferred.succeed(value).addCallback(callback, opt_scope);
800 }
801};
802
803
804
805/**
806 * An error sub class that is used when a Deferred has already been called.
807 * @param {!goog.async.Deferred} deferred The Deferred.
808 *
809 * @constructor
810 * @extends {goog.debug.Error}
811 */
812goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError = function(deferred) {
813 goog.debug.Error.call(this);
814
815 /**
816 * The Deferred that raised this error.
817 * @type {goog.async.Deferred}
818 */
819 this.deferred = deferred;
820};
821goog.inherits(goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError, goog.debug.Error);
822
823
824/** @override */
825goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError.prototype.message =
826 'Deferred has already fired';
827
828
829/** @override */
830goog.async.Deferred.AlreadyCalledError.prototype.name = 'AlreadyCalledError';
831
832
833
834/**
835 * An error sub class that is used when a Deferred is canceled.
836 *
837 * @param {!goog.async.Deferred} deferred The Deferred object.
838 * @constructor
839 * @extends {goog.debug.Error}
840 */
841goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError = function(deferred) {
842 goog.debug.Error.call(this);
843
844 /**
845 * The Deferred that raised this error.
846 * @type {goog.async.Deferred}
847 */
848 this.deferred = deferred;
849};
850goog.inherits(goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError, goog.debug.Error);
851
852
853/** @override */
854goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError.prototype.message = 'Deferred was canceled';
855
856
857/** @override */
858goog.async.Deferred.CanceledError.prototype.name = 'CanceledError';
859
860
861
862/**
863 * Wrapper around errors that are scheduled to be thrown by failing deferreds
864 * after a timeout.
865 *
866 * @param {*} error Error from a failing deferred.
867 * @constructor
868 * @final
869 * @private
870 * @struct
871 */
872goog.async.Deferred.Error_ = function(error) {
873 /** @const @private {number} */
874 this.id_ = goog.global.setTimeout(goog.bind(this.throwError, this), 0);
875
876 /** @const @private {*} */
877 this.error_ = error;
878};
879
880
881/**
882 * Actually throws the error and removes it from the list of pending
883 * deferred errors.
884 */
885goog.async.Deferred.Error_.prototype.throwError = function() {
886 goog.asserts.assert(goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_[this.id_],
887 'Cannot throw an error that is not scheduled.');
888 delete goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_[this.id_];
889 throw this.error_;
890};
891
892
893/**
894 * Resets the error throw timer.
895 */
896goog.async.Deferred.Error_.prototype.resetTimer = function() {
897 goog.global.clearTimeout(this.id_);
898};
899
900
901/**
902 * Map of unhandled errors scheduled to be rethrown in a future timestep.
903 * @private {!Object<number|string, goog.async.Deferred.Error_>}
904 */
905goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_ = {};
906
907
908/**
909 * Schedules an error to be thrown after a delay.
910 * @param {*} error Error from a failing deferred.
911 * @return {number} Id of the error.
912 * @private
913 */
914goog.async.Deferred.scheduleError_ = function(error) {
915 var deferredError = new goog.async.Deferred.Error_(error);
916 goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_[deferredError.id_] = deferredError;
917 return deferredError.id_;
918};
919
920
921/**
922 * Unschedules an error from being thrown.
923 * @param {number} id Id of the deferred error to unschedule.
924 * @private
925 */
926goog.async.Deferred.unscheduleError_ = function(id) {
927 var error = goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_[id];
928 if (error) {
929 error.resetTimer();
930 delete goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_[id];
931 }
932};
933
934
935/**
936 * Asserts that there are no pending deferred errors. If there are any
937 * scheduled errors, one will be thrown immediately to make this function fail.
938 */
939goog.async.Deferred.assertNoErrors = function() {
940 var map = goog.async.Deferred.errorMap_;
941 for (var key in map) {
942 var error = map[key];
943 error.resetTimer();
944 error.throwError();
945 }
946};
